Legal_Issue: Whether new evidence can be considered in a Section 56 appeal and whether it demonstrates sufficient use to prevent expungement
Procedural_Stage: Appeal under Section 56 of the Trade-marks Act
Evidence_Assessment: Invoices and affidavit showing 16 sales of L'AMADEI-branded clothing, including six to Canadian companies
Decision_Outcome: Expungement decision set aside; trademark registration maintained for specific clothing items
Burden_of_Proof: Applicant (Multi-Wear) to demonstrate use of the trademark within the required period
Credibility_Factor: Affidavit and commercial invoices deemed credible and sufficient
Legal_Rule: Section 45 requires use of the trademark in Canada within three years preceding the expiration of each registration period
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on nature of issue on appeal
Procedural_Issue: Admissibility of new evidence in an unopposed Section 56 appeal
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to provide timely evidence of use led to expungement notice
Outcome_on_Merits: Appeal allowed; registration upheld for certain goods
Review_Standard: Assessment of sufficiency of use and admissibility of new evidence
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Unopposed appeal with opportunity to submit new evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Invoices, affidavit documenting 16 sales, including domestic transactions
Applicant_Challenge: Overcoming expungement due to lack of initial evidence submission
Remedy_Requested: Set aside expungement decision, maintain registration
Outcome: Remedy granted; registration preserved for relevant goods
Decision_Authority: Federal Court or Trademarks Opposition Board, as applicable
Remedy_Sought: Prevention of expungement based on demonstrated use
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 45 and Section 56 of the Trade-marks Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Initial failure to file evidence of use
Applicable_Process: Ex parte appeal process under Section 56
Governing_Rule: Section 45 of the Trade-marks Act requiring use within three-year period
